Code Documentation¶

Find below the description of all the classes and methods used to build the AIM (Automated Incidence Management) system.

Engine¶

class lib.engine.Engine¶

Class used to manage processing of incidences.

When the engine is started no parameters are necessary, it automatically creates an

  • Incident Wrapper

  • Incident Base

  • Performs system check

configureIncident(id, category, sub_category)¶

Changes the classes of the incoming incident id

Parameters

  • id – The incidence id

  • category – The new category assigned to the incidence

  • sub_category – The new sub-category assigned to the incidence

deal(incident_entry_df)¶

Deals with the incoming dataframe entry as necessary.

Parameters

incident_entry_df – The dataframe version of the incidence to deal with

Returns

The id of the incidence to deal with in the database it has been added to

Return type

int

dealWithFile(file_path)¶

Processes a file at the given path and retrieves necessary information from it for the database, before deleting it

Parameters

file_path – The local path to the new incidence file

Returns

The id of the newly added incidence in the database, if successful

Return type

int

dealWithWebForm(form)¶

This method parses a given form and deals with the incidence within it.

Parameters

form – The form to parse and add to the database

Returns

The id of the newly added web form that will indicate success or not

Return type

int

performInitCheck()¶

Performs initialization checks.

retrieveFormFromId(id)¶

Returns all data for this incident id.

Parameters

id – The id of the incidence to retrieve

Returns

The form of the incidence with all its information filled in

Return type

form

Processor¶

class lib.processor.Processor(path_to_csv, model_url='/mnt/c/Users/SE71839/Desktop/BootstrapIncidences/lib/../models/multilingual-large')¶

” The processor class is used to embed the texts using the google multilingual embedder and get the text ready for the classification algorithm.

Parameters

Debug – The abstract super class Debug includes a debug log method which is inherited by all classes in the system to make debugging efficient.

clean_text(text)¶

Method used to clean the basic text of commas, punctuation, capital letters and other unwanted symbols.

Parameters

text – The individual text paragraph to process

Returns

The same text but cleaned

Return type

text

initialize(y_col='category', text_col='texto_sap', vec_col='vectorized_texts', drop_cols=[], test_ratio=0.2, random_state=0, vectors_available=False)¶

Initializes model and embeds the training set if necessary, aka if model hasn’t been downloaded before.

Parameters

  • y_col – The name of the column with categories

  • text_col – The name of the column holding the text complaints

  • vec_col – The name of the column holding the vectorized texts

  • drop_cols – The names of any columns we wish to drop from the database

  • test_ratio – The ratio of train to test data

  • random_state – The seed for the randomization algorithm, keep the same to recreate fair trials

  • vectors_available – Set to True if the vectorized database already exists to avoid re-creating the vectorizations

Returns

Sets the self variables of text_input, embedded_text, session, df, train and test sets.

processFrame(data_frame, text_col='texto_sap', drop_cols=[])¶

If vectors are not available, this method is called to process the texts and return a dataframe with a new vectors column for classifying.

Parameters

  • data_frame – The name of the column with categories

  • text_col – The name of the column holding the text complaints

  • drop_cols – The names of any columns we wish to drop from the database

Returns

The cleaned dataframe with the vectors column

Return type

df

readVector(text_vector)¶

Reads a string of vectors, as the model returns them, and returns an array of floats.

Parameters

text_vector – The string to read

Returns

An array of floats

Return type

vec

Configurator¶

class lib.configurator.ConfigGetter¶

This class returns the model string and parameter dictionary, the getter method for the class above.

class lib.configurator.ConfigParser(path_to_config)¶

This class reads and parses the config file to set important variables such as paths to models.

extractInfo()¶

Given the clean file, this method extracts the model and dictionary information.

Returns

The name of the model to use dictionary: The dictionary of parameters to use for the session.

Return type

string

parseFile(path_to_config)¶

Strips the file of spaces and commas.

Parameters

path_to_config – Passed in the constructor

Returns

The clean text from the file

Return type

string

class lib.configurator.Utils¶

A class with useful methods used when python-provided ones did not suffice.

static saveCSV(df, file_path, index=False)¶

This method was created for compatability - you can set a specific encoding for the spanish language, or any other encoding/os necessary.

Parameters

  • df – Pandas dataframe to save to the file

  • file_path – Where the file should be saved

  • index – If an index column is wanted in the dataframe saved in the csv file, set to true

Returns

Automatically saves the file, does not return anything.

Classifier¶

class lib.classifier.Classifier(training_df, y_col='category', vec_col='vectorized_texts', params={})¶

Abstract class used to classify the category and sub-category of a given SAP text.

getAccuracy(predictions_df, actual_df)¶

Returns accuracy of predictions vs the real categories. This method was used in the testing period.

Parameters

  • predictions_df – The dataframe with the datapoints and their predicted categories

  • actual_df – The real categories for the datapoints

Returns

The accuracy of the current model with the given dataframe.

Return type

float

getSplittedVectorsFrame(df, for_training=True)¶

This method builds the Xtrain and ytrain sets for the ML models by splitting the given dataframe. This method is more useful than the typical train test split python function as it takes into account the size of the vector encodings for each datapoint.

Parameters

  • df – The dataframe with datapoints to be split up

  • for_training – If for the training set, the category column will be added to the returned dataframe, if its for testing it won’t

Returns

The split training sets for training our model.

Return type

dataframe

giveClassification(test_df, model)¶

Classifies input dataframe given the input model. As it is an abstract class, depending on the model a different subclass will be used to classify the dataframe.

Parameters

  • test_df – The dataframe containing the dataframe to classify

  • model – The model to be used for the classification

Returns

The new classified dataframe

Return type

dataframe

class lib.classifier.ClassifierBuilder¶

Returns the correct classifier depending on the values given by the pre-made configuration class/file (check Configuration class)

getClassifier(y_col='category', vec_col='vectorized_texts')¶

Given the column that is to be predicted and the column holding the vector encodings, it will return the wanted classifier object with all its parameters done.

Parameters

  • y_col – The name of the column to predict, set in configuration

  • vec_col – The name of the column holding the vector encodings, set in configuration

Returns

The new classifier with the y col, vec_col, and parameters set.

Return type

classifier

class lib.classifier.ClassifierGaussian(training_df, y_col='category', vec_col='vectorized_texts', params={})¶

Creates Gaussian Naive Bayes classifier. This was for the testing period and was not used in the final website.

Has one method to classify a given test dataframe, using the params set by the super class, and returns the classified dataframe.

class lib.classifier.ClassifierLogistic(training_df, y_col='category', vec_col='vectorized_texts', params={})¶

Creates Logistic Regression classifier. This was for the testing period and was not used in the final website.

Has one method to classify a given test dataframe, using the params set by the super class, and returns the classified dataframe.

class lib.classifier.ClassifierSVM(training_df, y_col='category', vec_col='vectorized_texts', params={})¶

Creates SVM classifier. This was for the testing period and was not used in the final website.

Has one method to classify a given test dataframe, using the params set by the super class, and returns the classified dataframe.

class lib.classifier.ClassifierXGBoost(training_df, y_col='category', vec_col='vectorized_texts', params={})¶

Creates XGBoost classifier. This is the final model that was used.

Has one method to classify a given test dataframe, using the params set by the super class, and returns the classified dataframe.

giveClassification(test_df, model)¶

This method overrides the giveClassification method in the super class.

Parameters

  • test_df – Dataframe to classify, given without the category column

  • model – The model to use, in this case the XGboost

Returns

The classified dataframe.

Return type

dataframe

Incidence¶

class lib.incident.IncidentParser¶

This class parses excel files and forms that are uploaded in the website to be added to the database.

find(string, df)¶

Returns x and y coordinates of the first encounter of the string entered in a file, or -1, -1, if it doesn’t.

Parameters

  • string – The name of the wanted field

  • df – The raw dataframe of the excel file

Returns

Coordinates or -1 if not found

Return type

index tuple

getInfo(string, df)¶

Method that uses the look up and find methods to get the final information for a specific field in the given dataframe.

Parameters

  • string – The name of the wanted field

  • df – The raw dataframe of the excel file

Returns

Values for that specific variable name found in the excel file

Return type

list

lookUp(string)¶

A method to find the way to retrieve information for a given field from an excel file. This was pre-set based on the previously given excel files of incidences. The format for the dictionary is: <<FIELD NAME, whether the value is to its Right or Below, whether there is 1 value or more than 1 possible value, the real FIELD NAME, and the next field’s name.>>

Parameters

string – The field name for which we want to find the parsing method

Returns

Right/Below, 1 or 1+ values, Proper name in excel file, Next field name in file. If not in dictionary returns all 0s.

Return type

dictionary_element

parseFiles(list_of_files)¶

Parses files given and extracts the necessary information.

Parameters

list_of_files – The list of file names to retrieve

Returns

A list of the dataframes made from the list of files given list: A list of the information of the list of files dataframe: A final dataframe holding all the new incidents

Return type

list

parseWebForm(form)¶

Parses a given web form, an incidence filled in on the website.

Parameters

form – The form to be processed

Returns

The dataframe with the correct columns and values taken from the form

Return type

dataframe

class lib.incident.IncidentWrapper(path_to_database='data/')¶

Incidents Class used to wrap functionality of other classes. Adds the classification of category and sub-category.

keepGeneralCols(entry_df)¶

Finds the columns wanted to save the entry in the general database in the given dataframe.

Parameters

entry_df – The dataframe of the incidence to change depending on columns wanted for the general database

Returns

The dataframe given but only with the wanted columns.

Return type

dataframe

keepTrainingCols(entry_df)¶

Finds the columns wanted for training and keeps only those from the given dataframe. The column names wanted are set in the configuration file.

Parameters

entry_df – The dataframe of the incidence to change depending on the wanted columns for training

Returns

The dataframe given but only with the wanted columns.

Return type

dataframe

parseIncidentFromFile(path_to_file)¶

Given a path to a file, will parse it obtaining the wanted sections and return a panda dataframe for that data file

Parameters

path_to_file – Path to the file holding the incidence, in the case of an uploaded incidence for example

Returns

The parsed and processed dataframe found in the file.

Return type

dataframe

parseIncidentFromWebForm(form)¶

Parses an incidence when given through the web form.

Parameters

form – The web form to be processed

Returns

A dataframe holding all relevant information of the incidence uploaded.

Return type

dataframe

predictCategory(processed_incident_df)¶

Predicts the category of the processed indicent given.

Parameters

processed_incident_df – Incidence to classify

Returns

Same incidence given but with a new column for its category

Return type

dataframe

predictSubCategory(processed_incident_df, predicted_category)¶

Predicts the sub-category of the processed indicent given.

Parameters

  • processed_incident_df – Incidence to classify

  • predicted_category – The given incident’s category classification

Returns

Same incidence given but with a new column for its sub-category

Return type

Incidence Base¶

class lib.incidentBase.IncidentBase(incident_wrapper, path_to_training, path_to_vectors, path_to_incidents)¶

The interface to handle the incidence database. If the database changes, only this class has to be adapted.

changeIncidentClass(id, category, sub_category)¶

Changes the classification of an entry, finding it in the database by its id.

Parameters

  • id – The int id identifying the incidence

  • category – The new category assigned to the incidence

  • sub_category – The new sub-category assigned to the incidence

Returns

Passes the changed incidences to appropriate methods to update everything.

getEntry(incidence_id)¶

Finds and returns the required entry by its id, the aviso_de_Calidad, as a dataframe.

Parameters

incidence_id – The id that identifies the incidence

Returns

The found entry in the database

Return type

dataframe

getRelevantIndex(df_entry, df_database, log='')¶

Given an entry and a database, this method find the id of that incidence within the given database.

Parameters

  • df_entry – The index being searched for in the database as a pandas dataframe

  • df_database – The incidence database as a pandas dataframe

  • log – Log type

Returns

Index of the incidence in the database

Return type

int

updateIncidentData(df_entry)¶

Updates the incident database with the given incident, replacing or adding it at the end.

Parameters

df_entry – The incidence entry to be added to the database

Returns

Whether successful or not

Return type

boolean

updateTrainingData(df_entry)¶

Updates the training databases, both vector and non-vector, by adding or replacing a given incident.

Parameters

df_entry – The incidence entry to add to the database

Returns

Whether the addition was successful or not

Return type

boolean

Forms¶

class lib.forms.FormBuilder¶

This class allows a form to be created from a dataframe, a premade incidence, or an empty form when no incidence is looked up.

static buildEmptyForm()¶

This method returns a simple Info form with no filled fields. :returns: Simple empty information form :rtype: form

static buildFromEntry(entry_df)¶

This methods creates an Information form from a given dataframe, giving it the fields necessary.

Parameters

entry_df – The dataframe of the incidence to show on the form

Returns

The web form to display with the searched incidence

Return type

form

class lib.forms.InfoForm(fields=[])¶

This class is used to create an Incidence Form , for when an incidence is checked for its category or changed.

class lib.forms.WebForm(formdata=<object object>, **kwargs)¶

The Web Form class establishes the fields necessary in the WebForm to fill an incidence, so to change the form these fields must be changed.
